section.name: Installation requirements
section.p: Fess can be available in these environments.

ul.li: OS: Windows, Unix, and Java can run OS environment

section.p: If Java is not installed in the environment we want to Fess takes over Java 6 JDK from http://java.sun.com/, please install.

section.name: Download
section.p: http://sourceforge.jp/projects/Fess/releases/ From the download the latest Fess package.

section.name: Installation
section.p: Expand the downloaded fess-server-x.y.zip. If you installed in the UNIX environment, in the bin added the performing rights to a script.
section.source: $ unzip fess-server-x.y.zip $ cd fess-server-x.y $ chmod +x bin/*.sh # (Unix環境のみ)

section.name: Changing the administrator password
section.p: Administrator account is managed by the application server. Fess Server standard available Tomcat, as well as to the user changing the Tomcat. Modify the password for the admin account of the conf/tomcat-user.xml if you want to change.

section.name: SOLR server password change
section.p: To access the Solr into Fess server is password becomes necessary. Change the default passwords in production, etc.
How to change the password, you must first change the password attribute of the conf/tomcat-user.xml solradmin.
Describes the provided password webapps/fess/WEB-INF/classes/fess_solr.dicon the following points tomcat-user.xml to the next.
